derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English: from Anglo-Norman French maner 'dwelling', from Latin manere 'remain'

entry.def: A manor is a large private house in the country, usually built in the Middle Ages, and also includes the land and smaller buildings around it.

example.ex: Thieves broke into the manor at night.

example.tran: 萨福克郡海岸边的鲍德西庄园

entry.def: Some people, especially police officers, refer to the area where they work as their manor .

example.ex: The Chief Constable deeply resented any intrusions into his manor...
example.tran: 警察局局长对侵入其辖区的行为深恶痛绝。

example.ex: Thank God they're not on my manor any more.
example.tran: 谢天谢地，他们再也不在我的辖区里了。

means.word_mean: 1. the mansion of the lord of the manor
2. the landed estate of a lord (including the house on it)

list.explanation: 警察管辖区，地方警察机关

example.en: A: Then they whipped him down to the nick on the hurry-up.B: Which manor?A: The local nick.
example.zh: 甲:后来他们一下子把他打入了牢里。乙:哪个警察管辖区？甲:当地的监牢。

example.en: We went downtown to have a look at the manor. There was no Matthew Wilson on it anywhere.
example.zh: 我们去市中心的地方警察机关看了一下，根本没有马修·威尔逊这个人。
